;A kind of turbulence The infectious disease is spreading among the reindeer in Aoxiang.

;

;On the morning of July 18, 2023, veterinarian Lao Ge received a notice from the village that four reindeer had died in a row at a tourist spot, and he had to go check what was going on.

;

;Aoxiang, the full name is Aoluguya Ewenki National Township. Driving 250 kilometers northeast from Hailar, the central city of Hulunbuir, Inner Mongolia, is Genhe, the county-level city where Aoxiang is located. It borders Mohe, the northernmost part of China, and is the "China Cold Pole" certified by ;National Climate Center; ”——The annual average temperature is minus 5.3 degrees Celsius, and the heating period is 9 months.

;

;In Genhe, the name that is more famous than "China's Cold Pole" is undoubtedly "Ewenki".

;

;The Ewenki are one of the ethnic groups with a small population in China. According to statistics from the seventh census, there are 34,617 people in this ethnic group.

;

;Historically, there were three tribes of the Ewenki people. Among them, the safari Yakuts are called the "deer tribe" because they raise reindeer. The Ewenki people in Aoxiang are descendants of the Shilu tribe, also known as the Shilu Ewenki people. Their population has always hovered between one and two hundred people. They are the smallest micro-group within the tribe and the only ethnic group that raises reindeer in China.

;

;Rudolph the Red-Nosed, who pulls Santa’s sleigh, is the star among the reindeer. This is an animal that lives in the tundra around the Arctic Circle. Its two towering antlers are more than one meter long and have many branches like tree branches.

;

;But the reindeer in Aoxiang are facing a survival crisis. Lao Ge judged that the reindeer that died this time had a high probability of suffering from a blood parasitic disease with a very high fatality rate. He was "not surprised" by this situation.

;

; In 2003, Genhe implemented the "ecological immigration" policy. The Evenki people who originally lived in the deep forests put down their shotguns and went down the mountains to settle. Lao Ge suspected that the reindeer's illness may be related to the small animals that come with tourists.

;

;In media reports, the Ewenki people are called "China's last hunting nation." Today's Ewenki people are ending hunting and embracing a modern lifestyle. They also face the process of adaptation.

;

;However, for this micro-ethnic group, which has been maintained at a scale of a hundred people for a long time, it is also a choice that must be made in order to survive and develop.

;

;;

;

;On July 18, 2023, tourists fed reindeer in the largest reindeer park in Aoxiang. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Han Qian/picture);

;

;;"I miss you very much in Aoluguya";< /h4>;

;Ewenki originally means "people who live in the mountains and forests."

;

;In the past, both humans and deer lived in the deep forests of the Greater Khingan Mountains, and reindeer had never been heard of contracting infectious diseases. "It's hard for reindeer to work in the mountains." Lao Ge sighed, "There's nothing we can do to make money."

;

;In addition to being a veterinarian, Lao Ge also has another identity - the operator of the largest reindeer park in Aoxiang. By. On the way to see a doctor, his cell phone rang almost every ten minutes. Most of the calls were made by acquaintances who wanted to waive the 70 yuan ticket.

;

;Visitors who visit the reindeer park for the first time are often surprised: the reindeer roam freely in the scenic area without fences, and people can freely have close contact with them. If you spend 20 yuan to buy a basket of fresh moss, you will soon be stared at by the reindeer's big round eyes, its round and soft nose will come over, and it will dig straight into the basket.

;

;The staff teaches tourists how to take very dynamic photos: lift a bamboo basket filled with moss above your head and run, and the herd of reindeer will follow obediently. However, most tourists were so frightened that they dropped their bamboo baskets on the ground when they heard the hoofbeats of the reindeer behind them. At this time, you can always hear the staff shouting from behind, "Don't be afraid, don't be afraid, the reindeer will not hurt people."

;

;Besides the reindeer, Lao Ge himself is considered the second "star" in the reindeer park. ". He is 51 years old, a mixed race of Ewenki and Russian, with curly silver hair, a high nose bridge, deep eye sockets, and bronze skin. It is said that he looked like the French movie star Alain Delon when he was young. Tourists who have done some planning in advance often take photos with him.

;

;If reporters visit, the local propaganda department will most likely bring them to Lao Ge. He has a strong desire for expression and a vivid Northeastern dialect, which always makes reporters come home with a full load.

;

;Most of the time, tourists can find him in the most luxurious hotel in the park. Choluozi is the traditional residence of the Ewenki people in the mountains and forests. More than ten pine trees are intertwined to form a cone shape, and a layer of birch bark is spread outside.

;

;The reason why the tuoluozi is said to be "luxurious" is because the birch bark is densely surrounded by a layer of roe deer skin. There are dozens of them. According to Lao Ge, the cost is "worth seventy-eight dollars at least." Ten thousand". In the past, that was a treatment enjoyed only by "old hunters" (the term given to experienced hunters).

;

;Going west from Luyuan, less than 10 minutes’ drive by sightseeing bus, you will find the settlement of the Evenki people.

;

;In September 2003, the Evenki hunters had just moved to this settlement. There were 62 bungalows with red roofs and white walls in the settlement. In 2008, in order to develop tourism, the Aoxiang government renovated the house and specially invited a Finnish construction company to design it. The exterior facade was covered with dark brown wooden boards and the sloping eaves were wider, aiming to create a "Nordic style" .

;

;Twenty years later, except for a dozen families who still live here, most families have moved into residential communities in Genhe City. Their houses in Aoxiang have been converted into B&Bs and specialty shops. .

;

;"I miss you in Aoluguya" - the now pervasive Internet celebrity street signs have also invaded Aoxiang.

;

;Beside the street sign is the most conspicuous house with a huge reindeer mural painted on the exterior wall. It is a B&B run by Yang Lan, the granddaughter of Maria Suo, "the last female chief in China" .  

;

;Maria Suo is the prototype of the protagonist in Chi Zijian's novel "The Right Bank of the Ergun River". She died on August 20, 2022, at the age of 101.

;

;Many tourists are attracted by the old man’s legendary experience and follow his footsteps. On a sightseeing bus, the tour guide told the tourists the story of Maria Soo adopting a dozen orphans. "How come I didn't see any of them?" the sightseeing bus driver muttered after hearing this fictional story. The title of "the last female chief" is somewhat of a packaging color. There is no chief among the Ewenki people, but Maria Suo is indeed the most respected elder among the people.

;

;"Can't you tell some true stories?" However, for this driver, there is nothing to complain about. Driving a sightseeing bus in scenic spots gives him an extra 3,000 yuan in monthly income.

;

;Due to climate restrictions, Aoxiang’s tourist season is short. In previous years, Aoxiang’s attractions were only open from June 1st to October 8th. In 2023, due to the influence of the Zibo Barbecue Fever, the working season of the reindeer was advanced one month. At the end of April, before the snow had completely melted, the scenic spot opened.

;

;;

;

;Migration route map of the Ewenki people. ;(Liang Shuyi/Photo);

;

;;The third settlement;

;

;During the tourist season, Whenever he gets the chance, Lao Ge still likes to jump to the deer spot on the mountain. There was no cell phone signal there, and no one could find him. It was quiet.

;

;Except for the 32 reindeer that come down the mountain to "work", most of Laoge's reindeer are still herding deep in the Greater Khingan Mountains.

;

;After some hunters came down to settle down in the mountains, they still maintained "deer spots" where reindeer were grazed on the mountains. Officially, Deer Point is also called Hunters Point to distinguish it from the settlements at the foot of the mountain.

;

;On July 26, 2023, Lao Ge set off from Aoxiang, traveled more than 200 kilometers north to Alongshan Town, and then drove into the forest fire road from the only main street in the town. On the road, birch trees and larches are scattered at random, rose-red willows grow wildly on the roadside, and sables pass quickly in front of the car from time to time.

;

;Walking another 60 kilometers along the fire road, you can reach his deer spot, a place that cannot be pinpointed on the map. Lao Ge hired four relatives to take turns guarding the more than 180 reindeer on the mountain. As soon as we got off the car, the air was filled with a strong scent of pine. Four or five hounds approached Lao Ge with their tails wagging, and the sound of deer bells could be heard in the nearby woods. This is the environment the Evenki people are most familiar with.        

;

;Historically, the Ewenki were divided into three tribes: Solon, Tungus and Yakut, each engaged in agriculture, animal husbandry and hunting. In 1957, after ethnic identification, these three tribes were collectively called the Ewenki.

;

;Lv Guangtian, an ethnology scholar at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, has verified that as early as 2000 BC, the ancestors of the Evenki people lived on the shores of Lake Transbaikal and Lake Baikal. In the 17th and 18th centuries, the Shilu Ewenki people (hereinafter the Ewenki people are specifically referred to as the "Shilu tribe") came to the Greater Khingan Mountains on the right bank of the Ergun River, the border river between China and Russia, and never left.

;

;"People living in the mountains and forests" began to descend from the mountains after the founding of New China. At that time, the Ewenki people were hunting on the right bank of the Ergun River.

;

;In 1957, the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region approved the establishment of Qigan Ewenki National Township. Since then, allowing the Evenki people to settle has become a goal that the party committee and government hope to achieve. After the government built the wooden house (a typical Russian dwelling made of wood and mud), the Ewenki people had a place to settle for the first time. However, although they have a home at the foot of the mountain, except for the township head and the director of the supply and marketing cooperative who live there all year round, the rest of them live in a state of settlement and hunting. They hunt in the mountains for a long time and occasionally live at the foot of the mountain.

;

;In 1965, the Ewenki settlement moved eastward from Qigan to a place 17 kilometers north of Mangui Town.

;

;Kong Fanzhi, who once served as deputy director of the Standing Committee of the People's Congress of Genhe City, is a researcher of Ewenki culture. He said that the location of the relocation was very particular: in order to resolve the conflict between hunting and settlement, the settlement was chosen to be close to the hunting grounds and suitable for reindeer living.

;

;That is the original and real Aoxiang, so named because it is surrounded by the Aoluguya River. In the Ewenki language, "Aoluguya" means a place with lush poplar trees.

;

;In order to distinguish it from Aoxiang after the relocation in 2003, the settlement chosen at that time was habitually called "Old Aoxiang". For the Ewenki people, the period after the relocation was their "golden years." Schools, grain depots, post offices, hospitals, cultural stations and banks were built where 126 Evenki people originally lived. In order to develop the economy, the township has also set up wood processing plants, hunting production teams and ethnic trading companies. Foreigners also came. At its peak, there were more than 500 people living in Lao Ao.

;

;Kong Fanzhi recalled that in Lao Ao Township, the Ewenki people were considered "nobles". Maria Suo's family became the first 10,000-yuan household in the township in the 1980s. Many Ewenki families have bought cameras, bicycles, and "several watches." It does not cost money to go to school and see a doctor, and students can also receive living allowances. "All outsiders are willing to marry Ewenki people."

;

;At that time, young Ewenki people had settled at the foot of the mountain.

;

;According to statistics from Kong Fanzhi, by the 1980s, 40 of the 71 Ewenki adults in Aoxiang had jobs, becoming the first generation of teachers, doctors, drivers, and waiters among the tribe.

;

; However, nearly 40 years after moving to Lao Ao Township, the public facilities have begun to age, the government buildings have cracked, and the power grid and dams need to be repaired. The repair cost is estimated to be more than 10 million yuan, which is greatly exceeded. Root River's financial ability to pay.

;

;In 2003, the State Council launched the Western Development Plan, with funds earmarked for ecological migration. Therefore, the leaders of Genhe City decided that instead of repairing in situ, it would be better to apply for "ecological immigration", and the funds would also come from a source.

;

;The leader’s idea led to the third settlement in the history of the Evenki people.

;

; At 8 a.m. on August 10, 2003, the first batch of relocated 11 households with 37 people and 260 reindeer took 12 Dongfeng extended vehicles and headed for the new rural address more than 200 kilometers away. ——Departs from a place only 4 kilometers away from Genhe city. Teams organized by towns along the way lined the road to see off.

;

;The Genhe City Chronicle records that at 4 p.m., the convoy arrived at the new Aoxiang in the drizzle. "The new township site had colorful flags flying, gongs and drums roaring, and two elderly yangko teams singing and dancing."

;

;More than ten days before the move, Kong Fanzhi started busy receiving reporters. They recorded the last class of the school in Lao Ao Township, the "minimum post office" with only one employee, and the last bonfire before departure. Party.

;

;;;"Return to hometown after one day down the mountain";;

;

;;This relocation attracted Xie Yuanyuan, a Ph.D. in sociology from Peking University. On September 18, 2003, she arrived in Aoxiang and began a one-year field investigation. ;; ;

;

;;What aroused her interest was the reversal of the hunters' emotions. Before setting off, she noticed the report in ";;Beijing Youth Daily;;", the title was ";China's last hunting nation;The Ewenki people returned home after just one day of going down the mountain. Township;;”;;. ;

;

;;Beijing Youth Daily;;Reporters at;;Hunter;;relocation times;;Visiting Aoxiang on the ;; day, I found that the ;;yard was surprisingly quiet;;, and ;;some houses were empty;< span>;. Some hunters made a rough calculation: the annual income of a reindeer is about ;;200 Yuan ;;, ;; no ;; investment when raising stock in the mountains. After going down the mountain, ;;we have to ;; reindeer ;; in captivity ;;, ;; just the feed money, every day A reindeer costs thousands of dollars every year. ;;Originally, what the government promised was that the hunters would move, the reindeer would be kept in captivity, and someone would feed them. “The hunters would just hold the wine bottle and watch the reindeer smile.” ;

;

;;The reality is that there is no feed at all in the rows of deer pens blocked by brick-red barbed wire in the settlement. ;;During the relocation;;, some reindeer were lost, injured, and some were not used to eating bean cakes and choked to death. A total of more than 90 reindeer were lost. ;

;

;;Li Mengchu, chairman of the Aoxiang People’s Congress, was the Minister of Armed Forces of Aoxiang at the time. He recalled that at that time, the township government mobilized cadres to go up the mountain to collect moss, mushrooms and willow twigs. ;;A reindeer can eat a sack of moss in a day;;, which is equivalent to what one person can harvest in a day. ;;A few days later, the hunters ;; took the deer out of the deer pen and led ;; back to the mountain. ;;They;;first ;; reared them around Aoxiang, but ;;the moss in the mountains and forests around the city did not grow well; ;, ;;Go north again;; and continue deep into the hinterland of the Greater Khingan Mountains;;. ;

;

;Now, there are 14 deer spots scattered in the mountains and forests of Xinlao Ao Township.

; span>;20 years later, when talking about this matter, a former deputy mayor of Aoxiang said bluntly. ;

;

;;Writer Chi Zijian visited Aoxiang in 2004 and found that there was not a single reindeer in the deer pen, only a group of lazy goats wandering along the overgrown path. Go shopping. The butterfly effect caused by this situation was that the Ewenki people descended from the mountain and became the origin of the writing of "The Right Bank of the Ergun River". ;

;

;;While reindeer were being raised in captivity;;, the ;;Evenki people;; also put down their shotguns. ;

;

;;In fact, as early as 1988, with the promulgation of the Wildlife Protection Law, ;; it was clear that ;; hunting was prohibited , killing national key protected wild animals;;, ;;common prey of the Ewenki people, ;;moose;;, black bear, roe deer, gray rat ;;They are all on the list;;. In 1996, the Gun Management Law was promulgated, which imposed stricter regulations on civilian use of guns. ;

;

;;At that time, ;;Xie Yuanyuan obtained a document clarifying the meaning of "ecological migration" of the Ewenki people from the then director of the Ethnic Affairs Bureau of Genhe City. She was attracted by a few ;;;; short sentences with strong tone: ;

;

;;1. If the mode of production does not change, settling down will become a sentence Empty words. ;

;

;;2. Without changing the mode of production, it will be difficult for various economies to develop. ;

;

;;The material clearly expresses the point of view: to change the production method, reindeer must be kept in captivity so that hunters can put down their shotguns. ;

;

;;This also makes the third settlement essentially different from the first two: in the past two settlements, the government did not restrict the Evenki people’s choices, but instead increased their travel options. An alternative to hunting. But this time, the goal of letting the Evenki people go down the mountain to settle down is more clear. ;;We must change the ;;safari ;; such ;; "production" Way". ;

;

;;Ecological immigration has accelerated the process of closing guns. Li Mengchu remembered that the Public Security Bureau confiscated the guns of the Ewenki hunters right after they moved. ;

;

;;Gu Taozeng, a documentary director who filmed the "Ewenki Trilogy", recorded;;this process;;. Li Mengchu;;is concerned about;;that the Evenki people;;have hunted for generations to survive;;;; and their guns are gone. , which means a change in the tradition of hunting people. ;

;

;;Changes inevitably bring confusion. ;;Two months after the relocation;;More than a month later, the then Aoxiang Party Committee Secretary;;Liu Panchang;;’s nose bone was hunted by Ewenki The people interrupted, and the township head Gu Xianglian, who was also an Ewenki, was sued by his own aunt. ;

;

;Gu Xianglian’s aunt wrote to the then Secretary of the Hulunbuir Municipal Party Committee: “In the past, without subsidies or assistance, the hunters lived quite well. But now, in Genhe "To subsidize life is just like begging for food." "This is not trying to achieve a well-off life, it's just trying to make us eat chaff!"

;

;As soon as it's time to go to work, a circle of people rush into Gu Xianglian's office. The long sofas on both sides of the room were filled with villagers, and the radiator by the window was also crowded with people.

;

;The ancient fragrant lotus has nothing to do with it. She complained to Xie Yuanyuan: "I have no selfish intentions at all. I don't have a house of my own, so I live in a hunter's business. It's worse than a hunter's house! If you were to be the mayor of the township, what would you do?"

;

; There are problems everywhere. In November, the temperature in Aoxiang reached subzero, the new house began to get damp, and black hair grew on the walls of the house. The floor made of wooden boards in Lao Aoxiang was replaced by milky white ceramic tiles. ;The designer obviously doesn’t have much experience in rural life. As soon as you enter the house in winter, the snow stuck to the soles of your shoes melts quickly, and you may slip;; accidentally. ;

;

;;Making a living has become difficult;;;;, the Ewenki people used to be respected in Lao Ao Township;< span>;It seems;; is gone too. ;

;

;;Their appearance is easily identifiable: high cheekbones and deep-set eye sockets. When Xie Yuanyuan and Ewenki women went shopping in a store in Genhe City, they would always see the clerk pointing out, "Look, that's from Aoxiang." The restaurant owner also laughed at Xie Yuanyuan for their old-fashioned ways: they only served free side dishes and drank almost all the wine. Before the main dishes were served, I paid and left. ;

;

;Xie Yuanyuan recorded the scene she saw in the winter of 2003: except for the hunters raising reindeer, there was almost nothing for others to do. The only way for pure hunters to amuse themselves is to drink, drinking low-quality liquor that costs 1.5 yuan per pound and is filled with mineral water bottles. "There are three or five people, very quiet, not talking or laughing, just leaning on the sofa or leaning on the bed." Drinking like that. It feels like they want to get into a state of 'drunkness', the sooner the better."

;

; Twenty years have passed, and Gu Xianglian, who was the township head at the time of the relocation, is now the deputy director of the Standing Committee of the Genhe Municipal People’s Congress. "There is no need to talk about the past." On July 28, 2023, in her office, she quickly interrupted the reporter's question, "Go to Aoxiang and see for yourself. I don't know how much everyone's living standards have improved. . That's a huge change."

;

;;

;

;The Ewenki hunter settlement in Aoxiang is full of Nordic style. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Han Qian/picture);

;

;;;“Almost forgotten everything”; ;;; ;;

;

;;The latest improvement in living standards ;; celebrates "ecological migration" "20th anniversary. ;

;

;;On September 12, 2023, at the celebration ceremony, 15 dark green high-power tractors were lined up, which were allocated to the mountain;;Deer point. A month ago, the township ;;had ;;replaced ;; each deer spot with 5,000-watt solar energy storage panels. ;;When fully charged ;; , the solar panel ;; can provide ;;8 kWh of electricity. This means that you can use a refrigerator, TV, rice cooker, and even hot pot at the same time on the mountain. ;

;

;The summer travel season has also met expectations, ushering in a major outbreak three years after the epidemic. The price of accommodation in the two hotels in the scenic area is about 1,000 yuan per night. The price of a B&B with simple facilities not far from the scenic spot starts at 500 yuan per night, and it must be booked at least a week in advance.

;

;Genhe, a resource-based city built for forestry, has now positioned the cultural and tourism industry as the "city-building industry" in the government work report, and "Aolugu Ya" has become a key focus The “brand” created.

;

;“The living standards of hunters have improved a lot in recent years, and the original oppositional emotions have almost been forgotten.” Kong Fanzhi said when talking about the development of Aoxiang in recent years.

;

;;Change cannot occur without reindeer. ;

;

;In 2005, three years after the relocation, Li Mengchu was appointed deputy mayor of Aoxiang. How to allow the Ewenki hunters to make a living under the mountains became a difficult problem that he had to face as soon as he took office.

;

;Not long after taking office, he organized the first Reindeer King Competition, hoping to build the reputation of the reindeer. According to the plan, the antlers of the top three deer kings will be auctioned on site. Worried that no one would bid, Li Mengchu specially arranged a few "trustees" in the auditorium. Unexpectedly, the person in charge of a company auctioned off all the top three antlers, and the most expensive pair was auctioned for 7,000 yuan. At that time, an adult reindeer was worth only 5,000 yuan.

;

;The township government also took over the entire township’s deer antler business. Deer antlers are deer antlers that have not yet been boned. In traditional Chinese medicine, they are considered to have nourishing properties. Starting in 2005, Li Mengchu led the township cadres to various deer spots to cut the antlers, which would be processed by the township, packaged and sold. "After the sales are completed, the hunters will be given money, and they will be happy with every penny they receive."

;

;After a few years of unified sales, hunters no longer need government support. After the rise of tourism in Aoxiang, deer antlers are sold by the same gram as ginseng, with prices ranging from 8 to 20 yuan per gram depending on the quality.

;

;"Reindeer is the spirit of the Greater Khingan Mountains and the treasure of the Ewenki people." Lao Ge often repeated this sentence when interviewed by the media.

;

;No one can say how the tourism industry in Qing Ao Township became so popular.

;

;As soon as the Ewenki people came down from the mountain, the Aoxiang government made plans for tourism.

;

;When Xie Yuanyuan was investigating in Aoxiang, the government had built a "folk custom village". At first, there were only two buildings: a tent and a tuoluozi.

;

;The township government arranged for Asuo, a young male hunter, to live in a tent and raise 6 reindeer nearby. As long as he stays there, Asuo can receive a monthly salary of 100 yuan. However, Asuo's situation seemed awkward: he stayed there alone, drinking, dazed, and being sucked by mosquitoes. Later, the township leaders said that the "Folk Custom Village" was located in a remote location and lacked "life", so Asuo's "work" was stopped.

;

;After that, hunters gradually took over the business of the folk village, but they were all in a slump. In 2007, with the support of the township government, Lao Ge invested more than 100,000 yuan, and the township government signed a ten-year contract to take over the business of the reindeer park. "I never dreamed of it, but it started slowly."

;

;In Li Mengchu’s impression, around 2008, Hulunbuir’s tourism business suddenly became popular. At that time, tourists drove around Genhe and couldn't find a place to stay. "They were all confused at the time."

;

;Lao Ge’s specific feelings about Aoxiang’s tourism industry “taking off” come from the increasing number of reporters visiting. Several groups of reporters from different CCTV channels came. The camera crew of Japan's NHK's "China Railway Journey" also came, as well as teams from Thailand, Singapore, and South Korea. Reporters from various countries came to see it all.

;

;He also took reindeer to Changsha to record the variety show "Happy Camp". Lao Ge clearly remembers the broadcast time of the March 5, 2011 issue. He chartered a truck, hired two drivers, and took the reindeer with him, and it took him 85 hours to reach Changsha. Finally, the Ewenki clip appeared on the show for 5 minutes.

;

;Lao Ge was originally worried that the reindeer would be frightened after coming on stage and run wild all over the place. The result was good, the deer was calm and even peed on the stage. On the contrary, he himself was very nervous.

;

;This deer was later named "Little Hunan" by Lao Ge. The day after returning to Aoxiang, "Little Hunan" disappeared. Half a month later, a forestry worker 40 kilometers away discovered it. Its mouth and body were covered with hunter's nooses. "Little Hunan" did not survive that autumn and passed away.

;

;Later, a Hunan tourist made a special trip to the reindeer park and bought the antlers of "Little Hunan" for 2,000 yuan.

;

;

;On July 28, 2023, tourists watched birch bark boats at the Aoxiang Museum in Genhe City, Inner Mongolia. This was the most commonly used means of transportation by the Ewenki people half a century ago. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Han Qian/picture);

;

;;No longer follow the order of the past;

; < p>;In 2022, Lao Ge’s reindeer park began to be “regularized”, and the Aoluguya Tourism Development Company controlled by the Genhe Municipal Finance Bureau signed a three-year contract with him. Tickets are 70 yuan each, and he takes a 10% commission.

;

;"He is a busy man!" Speaking of Lao Ge, He Xie had not seen him for some days, let alone drank with him.

;

;He Xie, the eldest son of Maria Suo, the "last female chief", is known as Boss He. He always likes to wear a military green jacket and sits on a bench outside his home with his wife Zhuoye. He rarely speaks, holding a 3 yuan and 5 bottle of Hailar beer in his hand, and the volume of the radio on the window sill is turned to the maximum.

;

;When he was young, he enlisted in the army and served as a firefighter. After changing his job, he was assigned to work as a judicial assistant in the township government. At that time, he had thick, long black hair with natural curls, like a rock star. Now, he is 56 years old, his hair is gray, his face is covered with wrinkles, his eyes are squeezed to only a slit, and almost all his teeth are missing. Aging has completely overcome him.

;

;The distance from the bedroom to the bench is less than ten meters, which is the distance Zhuoye moves every day.

;

;Twenty-six years ago, He Xie was cleaning a gun at home, and the gun went off. The bullet penetrated the thin wall panel and entered Zhuoye's head. It has not been removed yet. The accident left her with no mobility in her right leg. After that, she stopped going out and became increasingly fat.

;

;When a curious tourist passes by the door and asks the couple about their Ewenki story, He Xie always walks slowly into the house and takes down two large photo albums from the top of the refrigerator - there is no smartphone yet. In the popular era, visiting reporters and photographers would always mail them to him after developing their photos.

;

;In the photo, they are skiing, singing, and drying dried meat in the forest. If you want to eat meat, pick up your gun and go out.

;

;When it comes to hunting, the energetic young hunter will briefly return - He Xie is the "old hunter" among the tribe who never misses.  

;

;Things in my memories are long enough. Most of the Evenki hunters in the photo have passed away, and the cause of death is somewhat related to alcohol. Of Maria So's seven children, only He Xie and his sister Dekesa remain.

;

;"If I hadn't looked at him, he would have been gone." Zhuoye said.

;

;"If you don't drink, what else can you do?" He Xie pushed back. His memories seemed to linger forever in the mountains and forests.

;

;Bai Lan, a researcher at the Institute of Ethnology of the Inner Mongolia Academy of Social Sciences, has been following the Ewenki people for more than 30 years, and has become old friends with He Xie's family. Sometimes, Bai Lan would receive a voice message from Zhuo Ye, lamenting that there used to be people in front of her house, but now, they are the only ones left.

;

;"We are all busy now, so how can we have time to drink with him." In Bai Lan's view, He Gong's arrogance as "Boss He" disappeared. He Xie loves to make money, and as soon as he has some money, he calls friends and invites people to drink. But today's Aoxiang no longer follows the order of the past.

;

;;

;

;On July 23, 2023, He Xie was in front of the graves of his mother Maria So and his father Rajmi He. ;(Southern Weekend reporter Han Qian/picture);

;

;The young Evenki people have their own way of survival.

;

;36-year-old Gu Musen has 300,000 fans on the short video platform. In 2022, he founded his own media company, signed up young people in the countryside to be "artists", and attracted tourists by relying on the fans he accumulated on the Internet.

;

;Some people who went to big cities to make a living have also returned. After graduating from college, Jue Le originally worked as an administrator in a hospital in Beijing, bought a house, got married, and had children in Beijing. But he felt that the work in the hospital was boring, and staying in the cubicle "was like turning on the mechanical mode." In 2016, Juele returned to Genhe and ran a tourist spot not far from Aoxiang. "It was very open, just like playing."

;

;Doing tourism business in Aoxiang can indeed bring considerable income. Juele estimates that he will earn more than 100,000 yuan from tourism in the summer of 2023, which will be enough to support his family throughout the winter.

;

;Bai Lan gave He Xie some advice. The couple was humorous in their dealings with others, and He Xie played the harmonica well. If they could clean up their house and start a small business in the tourism industry, they could make money. He Xie was not willing to do it and thought it was "boring".

;

;He Xie still maintains a rough drinking method: drink vigorously for a few days to get stronger, then sleep for a few days and nights, wake up, then get up and continue drinking.

;

;Lao Lie, who was once envied by others, has become a person who is left behind and "has not made progress" in the eyes of his relatives.

;

;At the end of July 2023, He Xie returned to Lao Ao Township. Not long after the Ewenki people moved out, the land was acquired by a real estate businessman in Daqing with plans to develop an international hunting ground. As a result, the plan was aborted, the hunting ground was not built, and all the old wooden carving houses were demolished.

;

;Old Aoxiang became a deserted land, and the weeds on the roadside grew as tall as half a person. He Xie walked around Lao Aoxiang with his hands behind his back, but he didn't recognize where his house was.

;

;A fellow traveler asked him if he would be willing to come back to raise deer again. He thought about it seriously. This place had been uninhabited for a long time, and there were more wolves and lynxes nearby. "It might not be appropriate to come back again."

;

;;;"Romanticism" and "Realism";;

;

;As National Day approaches, a brown bear has become big news in Aoxiang . At around 5 o'clock in the morning on September 26, 2023, Lao Ge received a call that a bear had entered the reindeer park - he entered through the ticket gate, and he was familiar with the road. This is the third time it has visited the deer park in half a month.  

;

;Lao Ge joked, "If it comes again, then we will have to deal with it." When it comes to the beasts that appear more and more frequently, the deer herder on the mountain doesn't sound so relaxed.

;

;In 2021, a brown bear visited Yang Lan’s deer spot and killed 7 reindeer in one night. In another household, after the arrival of the wolves, only 8 of the more than 30 reindeer were left. In the year when the beasts were most serious, the entire Aoxiang lost more than 200 reindeer, and the total number of reindeer was more than 1,300. In other words, one out of every six reindeer died due to beasts.

;

;Really annoyed, Yang Lan's father complained to her that if the guns could be returned to the hunters for a week, the problem of animal harm could be solved. Otherwise, in a few years, deer farmers will face personal danger even if they survive in the mountains.  

;

;Both the speaker and the listener know that this is just angry talk. They are all nationally protected animals, who would dare to fight them?

;

;The Ewenki people are also gradually losing their ability to survive in the mountains and forests, which makes Bai Lan feel a little anxious. How to choose between modernity and tradition? "Everything has given Ewenki an external intervention, so this culture will inevitably have its flaws." Bai Lan put forward this point of view in an interview with the media at the beginning of the ecological migration in 2003.

;

;She felt that if hunters could decide their own development model, obtain certain resource management and use rights in ethnic areas, and be able to engage in moderate logging and hunting, the situation might be different.

;

;“That’s the view of literati.” In 2003, Kong Fanzhi had a remote debate with Bai Lan. When he mentioned it again now, he still couldn't agree with Bai Lan's point of view. "We can't just let the Ewenki people live in Zuoluozi in order to protect their traditional culture, right? Who doesn't want to live a modern life?"

;

;In Xie Yuanyuan's view, these two attitudes come from completely different things. value judgement.

;

;During the research, she and Maria Saw lived in Deer Point for more than half a month. Get up at around five o'clock in the morning and work, such as beating legba, milking deer, picking wild fruits, cooking leather, and sewing leather goods... The days are simple and repetitive, and no one thinks that life needs any changes.

;

;Of course, Ewenki people of different ages have different pursuits. When younger hunters see the broader world, they will naturally feel that their nation's customs are backward and want to make changes.

;

;Xie Yuanyuan also wrote at the end of her doctoral thesis that traditional hunters who are attached to forest life do not have the right to speak and cannot easily sacrifice things that are more valuable and meaningful to the long-term development of mankind.

; p>;

;Twenty years later, doctoral student Xie Yuanyuan became a researcher at the National Institute of Strategic Studies of Tsinghua University. Today, in her opinion, Bai Lan’s views are “romantic”, while Kong Fanzhi represents the “realist”.

;

;It is inevitable for social development for micro groups to enter modernization. Now Xie Yuanyuan feels that from the perspective of national governance, this is a sacrifice that must be made for the development of the nation. Faced with reality, rational The attitude is to remember those people and give them and their descendants a certain amount of compensation. "This is the reality."

;

;In fact, since the Ewenki first settled and came into contact with the outside world, Some traditions are slowly changing.

;

;The Ewenki language has no written characters and can only be passed down orally from generation to generation. Even people as old as He Xie and Lao Ge cannot speak the Evenki language as well as Half of them are old people. The birch bark boat, the most commonly used means of transportation by the Ewenki people half a century ago, has long since drifted into the museum from the rivers of the Greater Khingan Mountains. When Lao Ge was young, he began to tie several rubber tires together to use as a boat. , much simpler than making a birch bark boat.

;

;Since the Ewenki hunters first settled in 1957, the young people who are now returning home to raise deer and run the tourism industry are already the third generation since the settlement. .

;

;"What about the next generation? " Bai Lan feels that the third generation who grew up in the mountains and forests have some affection for reindeer. The fourth generation of children who are not yet adults have lived on the cement floor since they were young. "What will reindeer be in the future? Maybe I don’t care anymore.”

;

;Kong Fanzhi believes that the reindeer will not disappear in Aoxiang. It is now the most important symbol of the Ewenki people and the reason why tourists rush to Aoxiang. “Others Nothing more to say."
